Description: Fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration and a partly glossy surface. The rear shows a convex impression with an irregular surface like from a bag or similar object, in the break an impressions of a cord with a width of 0.25 cm. The front side is slightly concave. In the lower part two thirds of an oval scarab-like seal-impression with a decorative pattern of small spirals around a small nfr-sign in the middle. The complete seal impression is preserved on EA86814 showing that the nfr-sign is mirror inverted on the other part of the spiral motif.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
